subSections.title: Japanese
subSections.text: {{ja-kanji forms|薬|藥}}

subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text: {{ja-kanji|rs=艸13|grade=3|kyu=藥}}

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|くす|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=くす}}. Cognate with the ''kusu'' root of adjective {{m|ja|奇し|tr=kusushi||mystical}}<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>, from the way that drugs and medicines would have mystical effects.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=kun|くす}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|くす|kyu=藥}}

# A [[medicine]] or [[drug]].

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Only used in compounds.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|くすり|yomi=k}}
From {{inh|ja|jpx-pro|*kusori}}. Derivation from ''kusu'' above. Appears to be the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or noun form}} of hypothetical verb ''kusuru'' “to have a mystical effect”.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=kun|くすり|acc=0|dev=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|くすり|kyu=藥}}

# A [[substance]] with [[mystical]] [[properties]], especially one that has an effect on the [[body]], [[health]], or [[lifespan]].
# A [[medicine]] or [[drug]], a [[pharmaceutical]].
# A [[chemical]], generally [[toxic]] and used for its effect on living organisms, such as [[insecticide]] or [[herbicide]].
# A [[substance]] that has a [[beneficial]] effect in improving or maintaining one's [[health]].
# {{lb|ja|sort=くすり|figurative}} Something that has a beneficial effect in correcting one's [[mistake]]s.
# {{short for|釉薬|tr=uwagusuri|dot=:|lang=ja}} A [[glaze]] or [[enamel]] applied to [[ceramic]]s.
# [[gunpowder|Gunpowder]] (from the “mystical substance” sense, and the second character in the word {{m|ja|火薬|tr=kayaku||gunpowder}}).
# {{lb|ja|sort=くすり|figurative}} A small [[bribe]].

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The [[medicine]] sense is probably the most common in modern Japanese.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=on|やく}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=やく}} {{zh-l|藥|tr=yak|drug, medicine}}. Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} {{zh-l|藥|tr=joek6}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=on|やく|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|やく|kyu=藥}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=やく|slang}} A [[medicine]] or [[drug]], especially a [[narcotic]] or other [[recreational]] drug.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The slang meaning is generally limited to when the term ''yaku'' is used as a standalone noun. In compounds, ''yaku'' refers more generally to [[pharmaceutical]]s, or sometimes [[chemical]]s.

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|薬%液|やく%えき}}: a [[liquid]] [[medicine]]
* {{ja-r|薬%園|やく%えん}}: a [[field]] or [[garden]] for cultivating [[medicinal]] [[plant]]s, especially during the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]]
* {{ja-r|薬%害|やく%がい}}: [[harm]] caused by a [[medicine]] or [[drug]]
* {{ja-r|薬%学|やく%がく}}: [[pharmacology]], the [[study]] of [[pharmacy]]
* {{ja-r|薬%学%者|やく%がく%しゃ}}: a [[pharmacologist]]
* {{ja-r|薬%局|やっ%きょく}}: a [[pharmacy]], a [[pharmacist]]'s office
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: References
subSections.text:
